    "the kernel of the kirwan map in theorem  [ th : surjective ] has also been described in very general terms , which we present below as theorem  [ th : tw ] .",
    "these results hinge on the key fact that for compact hamiltonian torus spaces , the equivariant cohomology injects into the equivariant cohomology of the fixed point set under the natural restriction map @xcite .",

    "we prove this theorem in section  [ se : wallstheorem ] .",
    "first we state several basic facts about equivariant morse theory ( as developed in @xcite ) .",
    "we then refine these ideas to gain equivariant homotopy information that is standard in the case that the morse function has only isolated critical points and there is no group action .",
    "let @xmath94 be a smooth function on a compact manifold @xmath1 and @xmath66 a connected component of the critical set of @xmath94 on @xmath1 .",

    "the hessian @xmath96 ( the matrix of second derivatives of @xmath94 ) is non - degenerate on the normal bundle @xmath97 of @xmath66 in @xmath1 .",
    "if every connected component of the critical set is non - degenerate , we say @xmath94 is _ morse - bott_. at every non - degenerate critical submanifold , we use the riemannian metric to identify a neighborhood of the zero - section in the normal bundle @xmath97 with a tubular neighborhood of @xmath66 in @xmath1 .",
    "the hessian defines a splitting @xmath98 into positive and negative normal bundles .",
    "the dimension of the fibres of @xmath99 is called the _",
    "morse index _ of @xmath66 and is denoted @xmath100 .    now assume that @xmath1 has a @xmath0 action , where @xmath0 is a compact torus , and that the metric and the function @xmath94 are invariant with respect to this action .",
    "the splitting of @xmath97 into positive and negative bundles is equivariant .",
    "this setting mimics that in which @xmath94 is a generic component of the moment map , and @xmath66 is a connected component of @xmath30 .",
    "the proofs of the following two lemma are close to identical to those presented by milnor @xcite in the case that critical manifolds are points and there is no group action .",
    "we note only the minor differences in this more general setting . to make the lemmas true for morse - bott functions , all local calculations must include extra coordinates along the critical manifolds . to make the lemmas equivariant , we choose an invariant riemannian metric ( so that the group acts by isometries ) and we equivariantly identify a neighborhood of the zero - section in the normal bundle of a critical submanifold with a tubular neighborhood of that submanifold ( see @xcite ) .",
    "this makes all relevant maps and homotopies equivariant . for lemmas  [ le : morselemma1 ] and [",

    "we note that the theorems proven below can be generalized ( using lemma  [ le : morselemma2 ] ) to include the case that @xmath94 does not have distinct values for distinct critical sets , however the notation becomes cumbersome .",

    "in this section we use equivariant morse theory to prove theorem  [ th : equvtsurjective ] , that the equivariant kirwan map is surjective .",
    "this proof follows very closely tolman and weitsman s rendition of kirwan s result ( theorem  [ th : surjective ] ) in the case where @xmath190 .",
    "the main elements of this proof are found in @xcite , modified to allow for a torus action commuting with the @xmath191 action and for the possibility of non - generic @xmath26 .",

    "in this section , we prove an important refinement of theorem  [ th : kernel ] .",
    "it states that the collection of @xmath274 for a small number of @xmath194 are sufficient to generate the kernel of the map @xmath275 .",
    "in particular , one can consider only such @xmath14 which are perpendicular to codimension-1 walls of the moment polytope .",
    "we illustrate the main theorem of this section with an example .",
    "let @xmath1 be a generic 6-dimensional coadjoint orbit of @xmath276 .",
    "the maximal torus @xmath277 of @xmath276 acts on this orbit in a hamiltonian fashion .",
    "the image of the moment map is a hexagon , and the codimesion-1 walls of the moment polytope are shown in figure  [ fig : su3coadjointorbit](a ) .",
    "consider the reduction at the point @xmath38 indicated . according to theorem  [ th : tw ] , a generating set for the kernel of the map @xmath278 would include classes which restrict to 0 on fixed points whose images under the moment map ( indicated by vertices ) lie to one side of any hyperplane through @xmath38 .",
    "in particular , the class @xmath93 whose restrictions to the fixed points is indicated by figure  [ fig : su3coadjointorbit](b ) would be a generator of the kernel because it is 0 to one side of the hyperplane @xmath279 .",
    "theorem  [ th : wallssufficient ] states that such a class is redundant ; it will in fact be generated by classes which are 0 to one side of a hyperplane through @xmath38 _ parallel to a wall _ of the moment polytope . in figures  [ fig : su3coadjointorbit](c ) and [ fig : su3coadjointorbit](d ) we see two classes which are in the kernel according to theorem  [ th : wallssufficient ] and whose sum is @xmath93 .",

    "if @xmath281 is not maximal dimension , then every codimension-1 wall containing @xmath281 has this property .",

    "let @xmath319 be the product of symplectic manifolds @xmath320 , each with a hamiltonian @xmath2 action .",
    "theorem  [ th : wallssufficient ] allows us to say a lot about the reduction of @xmath1 by the diagonal torus action .",
    "we note that the diagonal torus @xmath321 is a subtorus of the product @xmath322 acting on @xmath1 . if the torus is just one - dimensional , theorem  [ th : wallssufficient ] is not more useful than the original formulation of theorem  [ th : tw ] .",
    "it is when @xmath323 that one can significantly reduce the number of vectors needed to generate the kernel of @xmath324 .",
    "we calculate the cohomology of the reduced space for a product of two copies of @xmath8s , where we have quotiented by the diagonal @xmath325 action .    by the moment map condition ( [ eq : momentmapcondition ] ) , if we choose the symplectic forms @xmath21 on @xmath326 and @xmath327 , @xmath328 on @xmath329 , the image for the moment map for the @xmath2 action on @xmath329 is that for the action of @xmath2 on @xmath326 dilated by @xmath33 .",
    "the image of the moment map for the diagonal @xmath2 action on @xmath330 is the sum of the moment maps for each component .",
    "let @xmath331 and @xmath2 act on @xmath320 by @xmath332=[z_0 : e^{i\\theta_1}z_1 : e^{i\\theta_2}z_2]$ ] .",
    "choose @xmath333 and let @xmath334 be a moment map for the diagonal action .",
    "then @xmath335 with its walls is pictured in figure  [ fig : cp2productmomentmap ] .",
    "the image of fixed points are labeled and indicated by vertex dots , and the image of fixed point sets of codimension-1 tori are indicated by line segments , which in this case form codimension-1 walls of the moment polytope .",
    "we find the cohomology of the symplectic reduction @xmath336 where @xmath38 is the point indicated in the figure by finding the kernel of @xmath337 using theorem  [ th : wallssufficient ] .",
    "we note that there are three distinct hyperplanes through @xmath38 parallel to walls of the moment polytope : horizontal , vertical , and diagonal with slope -1 .",
    "consider first @xmath338 . by the equivariant knneth theorem , @xmath339 where @xmath340 is the diagonal torus .",
    "@xmath341 is generated in degree 2 , by characteristic classes inherited from the module structure @xmath342 , and the equivaraint symplectic form on @xmath8 .",
    "we use the chosen basis for @xmath343 and denote the characteristic classes by @xmath344 and @xmath345 .",
    "these classes restrict to themselves on each fixed point of @xmath2 on @xmath8 .",
    "let @xmath151 be ( the multiple of ) the equivariant symplectic class given by the restrictions indicated in figure  [ fig : symplres ] .",
    "similarly , @xmath344 and @xmath345 are degree 2 equivariant classes on @xmath346 which restrict to themselves at every fixed point of the @xmath321 action on the product . by ( [ eq : kunneth ] ) the classes @xmath347 and @xmath348 generate @xmath349 . here @xmath350 .    note that a fixed point of @xmath346 is a pair @xmath351 .",
    "the restriction of a class on the product space to a fixed point is @xmath352 where @xmath353 .",
    "the algebraic structure of these classes is inherited by multiplication on each fixed point .",
    "the betti numbers for @xmath349 are easy to compute . as graded vector spaces , @xmath354 .",
    "it follows that the equivariant poincar polynomial for @xmath346 is @xmath355 we noted above that @xmath356 and @xmath357 are four linearly independent degree 2 classes .",
    "a choice of 10 linearly independent degree 4 classes is @xmath358 and @xmath359",
    ". the restrictions of these classes to the fixed point set @xmath360 is determined by the formula ( [ eq : productrestriction ] ) . as an example",
    ", we compute the restriction of @xmath361 to the fixed point set",
    ". see figure  [ fig : x2restriction ] .",
    "we have left to find the kernel of @xmath362 .",
    "the reduced space @xmath363 has ( real ) dimension @xmath364 thus we expect all classes of degree 6 or higher to be in the kernel of @xmath365 . in degree 2",
    ", we can easily see that no linear combination of the four classes above will restrict to 0 on one side of any of the three hyperplanes parallel to walls of the moment polytope . by theorem",
    "[ th : wallssufficient ] , there are no degree 2 classes in @xmath366 . in degree 4 , however , we expect nine ( of ten ) linearly independent classes to be in the kernel , as the image of @xmath57 is ( a multiple of ) the volume form on the reduction .",
    "the reader can verify using ( [ eq : productrestriction ] ) that the following classes restrict to 0 on one side of one of the three hyperplanes through @xmath38 parallel to a wall of the moment polytope : @xmath367 and @xmath368 .",
    "they are all linearly independent , which can be verified rather tediously . as an example",
    ", one can see in figure  [ fig : x2restriction ] that @xmath361 restricts to 0 on one side of the diagonal hyperplane through @xmath38 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be a compact torus acting on a compact symplectic manifold @xmath1 in a hamiltonian fashion , and @xmath2 a subtorus of @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> we prove that the kernel of @xmath3 is generated by a small number of classes @xmath4 satisfying very explicit restriction properties . our main tool is the _ equivariant kirwan map _ , a natural map from the @xmath0-equivariant cohomology of @xmath1 to the @xmath5-equivariant cohomology of the symplectic reduction of @xmath1 by @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> we show this map is surjective . </S>",
    "<S> this is an equivariant version of the well - known result that the ( nonequivariant ) kirwan map @xmath3 is surjective . </S>",
    "<S> we also compute the kernel of the equivariant kirwan map , generalizing the result due to tolman and weitsman @xcite in the case @xmath6 and allowing us to apply their methods inductively . </S>",
    "<S> this result is new even in the case that @xmath7 . </S>",
    "<S> we close with a worked example : the cohomology ring of the product of two @xmath8s , quotiented by the diagonal 2-torus action . </S>"
  ]
}
